subject: Personal Finance
title: Debt and Mental Health
description: A short lesson to help you apply Debt and Mental Health.

hook.text: People in debt are three times more likely to suffer from depression. The link is well documented.

buildup.text: Debt creates chronic stress. The constant worry about payments activates the brain's threat response.

discovery.text: Financial stress impairs sleep, relationships, and job performance â€” making the debt even harder to repay.

twist.text: Shame keeps people silent. Many hide their debt from partners and friends, increasing isolation.

climax.text: Addressing debt as a health issue, not just a financial one, leads to better outcomes.

punchline.text: Debt doesn't just cost money. It costs health.

quiz.question: How much more likely are people in debt to experience depression?
